wikipedia_page.main:
Kenneth Robert James Bingham (born 20 September 1980), known as Kenny Bingham, is a former English cricketer and rugby union player.  Bingham was a right-handed batsman who played primarily as a wicketkeeper. As a rugby player he played mostly on the wing.
Bingham was born in Oxford, Oxfordshire, and went to St Edward’s and Loughborough University.
Bingham represented the Kent Cricket Board in 2 List A matches.  These came against Hampshire in the 2002 Cheltenham & Gloucester Trophy and the Leicestershire Cricket Board in the 2nd round of the 2003 Cheltenham & Gloucester Trophy which was held in 2002.Bingham played both sports for a number of years before deciding to concentrate on Rugby Union, representing The Barbarians, England Counties, Richmond and Newbury.
